lexUnit.name: amusement.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the state or experience of finding something funny.

sentence.text: I noticed with amusement that the tapestries hanging there illustrated the seven deadly sins .
I remembered his amusement about such underwear on his first evening at Sleet , how he subsided into laughter , infectious to everyone but me .
Our amusement at his false assumption seemed to ease the tension between us .
However , I thought you might share my amusement at the thought of baked beans at a low tension !
His amusement at the scene was rekindled .
There was a cool mockery in his deep voice , and she turned to glare at him , hating him for the fact that he seemed to be deriving amusement from her discomfort .
` Can I help you ? " she asked , trying not to let him see the amusement in her blue eyes .
There was amusement in Jake 's voice , but there was something else as well .
Remember that hypnosis is not a party game to be practised by amateurs for the amusement of themselves or others .
The simple , laughing islanders subsequently worshipped it as a god , much to the amusement of their more sophisticated neighbours .
I have been sent a Leeds United 1993-94 squad picture from the Evening Post and this now adorns my office wall , much to the amusement of my colleagues .
He laughed shortly , little amusement on his face .
Aristophanes shook his handsome head over his friend 's amusement .
This time , the Prince 's amusement was obvious .
The note of anger carried to the groups and couples passing by , provoking amusement and raised eyebrows .
You could make a fortune , " she said in genuine amusement .
Agnes watched with amusement as his interest quickened or faded with each phrase .
Gioella 's eyes flashed with amusement as she pushed a chair towards her and said , ` Constance , what a very sophisticated dress .
Guy Sterne was having great difficulty in controlling his amusement .
Temperamental differences operate once more with this new trio of junior heroes , whose elders , the three lieutenants , regard their pranks with mild amusement .
From the other end of the table Ymor watched with mild amusement , occasionally feeding one of his ravens with scraps from his plate .
I hate to disappoint anyone but that was n't the case -- although the veiled hints caused us plenty of amusement .
He uttered a short sharp bark , which made Rosie jump ; she assumed it was a cough , then realised that it was intended as an expression of amusement .
He considered this thoughtfully , then a gleam of amusement came into his eyes .
A look of intense amusement crossed Catherine 's face .
As a toddler she filled in concentric circles provided for her amusement by her father 's youngest brother , young enough to be her own big brother .
A smile of amusement played on his lips as he studied his unkempt prize .
